name: Forge of Gods (RPG)
description: Join the action in this highly addictive multiplayer card strategy RPG “FORGE OF GODS”! Collect and train as many monsters as you can to assemble the greatest team and burst through hordes of enemies in thrilling, addictive and fast-paced game!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 Memory: 2 GB RAM DirectX: Version 9.0 Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 450 MB available space

reviews.review_text: This game feels more like it belongs to a Mobile App than something that should be on Steam.  I've played and seen similar games within the Mobile App stores; this game in particular seems to have a combination of systems utilized: The fusion/max-level bonus evolution system found in multiple card game RPGs, and the battle system is reminiciant of the 'advancing army' style of play. This style of gameplay isn't as common as other types of games within the Mobile market, but it is present.  That's about as much good I can say, however. There's definitely many more bads to goods to this Steam App:  When I played the game, the game felt a bit laggy while controlling my characters or navigating the menu. I don't know if it's my OS that caused this, but it very quickly got irritating.  The UI doesn't feel modified for a PC. Often, I have difficulty selecting the unit that I want to move, which doesn't help considering the already-present lag. When I try to click a unit above another, I'll end up selecting THAT unit instead. There's also grammar and font issues, as well, which is something one SHOULD fix when porting a game from the Mobile market.  Finally, when I tried closing the window with Alt+F4 or the corner button, it instead kept bringing me to the Gem Purchase menu. I get that the game is free-to-play, but this seems like a very underhanded move, especially when all I wanted to do was close the game. This part here was the nail in the coffin towards my feelings about this game; it felt less like a legitimate attempt at a good game and more like an attempt to desperately harvest money from players.

I was suprised to see a F2P with high ratings, I thought I'd give it a go... I would only presume at this point the casuals who like to call themselves gamers have dominated the reviews system.  Once you get imposed with effectively an energy bar (can't play without the energy(meat)) it becomes a waiting game. The game is constantly screaming 'BUY ME' with it's rediculous in-app purchases  The UI is clunky, there's not much in the 'Settings' department. Until you've done the tutorial you can't escape the intrusive popups to explore options or other areas of the game (such as settings) and even then, once the tutorial is over, the intrusively unhelpful tips keep popping up. The game doesn't stop reminding you about the tutorial or tips in this fashion, such as 'double click to see stats and more information' - yet try to do this over say an item or your ranking icon and the story is entirely different.  After 2 hours, I have nothing to do but grind earlier levels to find the cards I need, mashing space-bar or facing the possibility of buying an item that effectively auto-bots for you, some top-notch gameplay right there.  Frankly, this seems like a mobile game or Facebook converted game... Quick buck, little entertainment or replay value - which is a shame, quite frankly I found this game concept quite promising at first. Should keep this tripe off Steam/PC platforms. This is the perfect example of a money hungry and quite frankly destructive F2P model game, that not only degrades itself but the value of the 'F2P' label.  Developers should really play their own games before they release them - derp.

Grindy free-to-play trash. Plays like it belongs on a smartphone or tablet. Has more than 5 seperate currencies for doing various things. Lots of RNG and creature evolving and leveling up but you can also buy any creature for real money if you're found it once so that doesn't mean much.  Game has two difficulties; practically plays itself, and 'come back when you've grinded some more'. You can use real money to buy powerups to get through a level if you like but why waste money on this worthless cashgrab?  3/10

Just another pay-to-win game. Do not waste your time nor your money.  The gameplay is addicting in the beginning, but becomes fastly repetitive and boring. You will need to buy a lot of summon spaces, as you get a lot of monsters in every playthrough.  Auto-play, cash-based pvp, grinding, and 10 grades of rarity. Yes, 10 grades! They're trying to make you open your wallet at all costs.  The RPG part ends in the levelling system. Not really a good story and you don't really have the feeling that you're making any progress in the game, as everything is just fully automated.  Definitely, do NOT play this game.
Very good and addictive game :) Doesn't cost anything so try it maybe you'll like it ...

At the first sight the impression about this game was not clear, but after couple hours I loved it. Graphics looks like mix of Heroes 3 and Disciples 2, but with unique atmosphere which I like. Combat has RPG and strategy elements. The main goal of the game Is collect, improve many different creatures and find the best setup for PVE/PVP opponents. Exploring world, we complete challenges, open new different sectors, collect creatures and ingredients for their improvements. It's so cool, that in this game we can create guilds for cooperating with other players, fighting in guild wars and farming raids. That's why I want to play this game everyday, there are a lot of different gameplay features.    For me, it's not a 'time killer', because you play such games from time to time. Forge of Gods is the game, which you can easy start to play and don't need to play it 24/7 to be on top, there are a lot opportunities in this game and I like to play it with friends

I have played this game about 98 hour until now (3 week maybe), at first it seem like a game 'pay to win' but actually the summon method is random, so if u have 100$ u may still not stronger than a 3 week player, anyway the pack to 'pay' cost too hight (to not buy them). I feel it's similar to the game summoners war on mobile, lucks and efforts still the main.

Hello there, since this is a free to play game ( and a pay to win one ) my review will be on just my time playing.   1) Story is meh, most of it honestly people will end up skipping past.  2) Monsters or troops, meat and potatos of the game, good lot to choose from ( but again P2W)  3) Musics not bad at all, I have heard worse.  So in a nutshell its a good game, give it a try it is free to try out. Works a little like most phone or facebook apps, the feel of it being on steam seems to be left out some how.  Crashes happen often for me but singled out around when I click the pvp windows or move to and from friends list.  My advice is save your gems the green diamonds! Do not waste them on the stupid little purple and blue boxes you get that tease you with 5 troops is a crap shoot. I wish some one told me how bad they were, I opened a 100 gem one and got the 1 guy who was uncommon and none of the 4 others who were IV ranked.  Game could be a lot worse, like owned by Disne.... Good Luck.

Unoptimized grind-fest ported from mobile with clumsy, touchscreen-based, interface. Gameplay is your typical click-upgrade-wait-repeat. Graphics was ported along gameplay so expect to see huge pixels everywhere. I would suggest you to grab mobile version. It fits better to controls scheme, and its gameplay suits usual circumstances when we play on mobiles. Beside all of that game itself will keep you occupied for some hours if all you are looking for is to tap screen. Game is free so if you are bored to death this will give you some kind of questionable entertainment.
Nice game which makes you wanna come back every day.

Unbelievably addicting. 8/10   I keep meaning to get through my other non-free steam games.... and then chucking several hundred hours into this instead, wtf self.  Fantasy TBStrategy meets MMORPG! The guilds are really friendly, the competition is fun, and each unit is creative and *just* challenging enough to be both a pain in the butt, but really really fun. Add friends for promos, follow them on twitter or FB, make sure you try at least once a day and you'll find yourself completely addicted too.  Add guilds and steam list friend codes for extra bonuses ;) And check out the facebook or twitter for even more promos!  The one 'downside' is that you are expected to know how to do this from the getgo. While it starts off very easy, there's no real tutorial and only hints for directions. -> TIPS 101! You can and SHOULD move your pieces around, do not keep them static in between turns. You can speed it up, but UN-SPEED to move your pieces around. Splash damage is great for going through levels, and REPLAY LEVELS, you'll want to grind XP as much as possible! Going through a map without losing anyone (or using your revives) will get you 10 bonus meat -> but the meat counter refills with time, so always make sure to have some used!! If you get meat from friends/guild quests/ETC. save it for when you really need it, and everytime your main hero levels up, the meat counter refills, so never use juicy meat/hearty meals just before leveling up. Also you can never ever EVER have enough gold, so don't waste it, and don't be afraid to hoard it for later. YOU WILL NEED IT. And ONLY use your fruits to fuse with units you use a lot and plan to use a lot. They're expensive, don't sell well, and are pretty hard to obtain.  REALLY fun game, Have fun!
so good and fun and is easy

This game is well worth trying out for Free. It's a great little time waster that you can play a fair bit of without ever spending a dollar. And if it does grab you... the paywall is yet another VIP tier based one. Not worth paying, only play it for free.

WaitForPlay in PayToWin Game. U don't need more information about this game. 0\10$ in dev purse.  'Жди чтобы играть' Самая утомительная и кретиническая система взымать деньги из игроков - это вынуждать их платить за то, что они хотят играть в бесплатную игру. При таких раскладах проще купить любую платную игру в том числе ММО, требующие единоразовой оплаты. Вангую, игра умрёт из-за низкого онлайна т.к. вливать тысячи долларов в мобов, при этом не имея возможности играть столько, сколько хочешь - ни один вменяемый игрок не станет. Более того, в игре, где ПвП нет, хотя разработчику очень хочется верить в то, что оно есть. Да и сам донат был бы не так остро необходим, если бы игрокам дали возможность играть столько, сколько они могут(или хотят). Хотя стоп, это ведь значит, что разработчик перестанет получать деньги! Примитивное мышление наглых, бессовестных кидал.

It's a mobile port, done relatively poorly (there's lag sometimes, color depth looks like 16-bit), and the choice of Comic Sans font for literally everything is catastrophic.  A good time waster nonetheless. Can't honestly recommend since there are better ones out there though.

For a free game I can't be to harsh on it but jeez.... ok let's just get this over with. Before I talk about this games pros and cons I'm just going to say that if they improve the gameplay I may, MAY, play it again :3  Pros- > It's free and doesn't take long to get the hang of, > A quest system! I love quests! > I like it that you can check what the enemies stats are while in a battle > There are multiple characters to pick at the beginning, giving variety to the play styles  Cons- > The intro video doesn't tell you ANYTHING interesting about the game. > I thought the quests would be decent, but they're REALLY not. > The music might as well be wake me up inside ear ♥♥♥♥ > The music is muffled, making it very unconfortable to play levels slowly > The tutoriel kinda ends quickly and leaves you in the dark for a while, giving you blinds tips every few minutes, > Ok ok ok, wtf is up with spiders, like seriously its difficult to get through the third/fourth level with them against you > Your character/any of your people can be countered EASILY > 'Collected' souls seem to be able to flee, how are they collected if they're going to flee?  But the thing that bugged me the most, was not the music, not the ads begging for you to spend some of your money (don't), but the thing that made me stop playing the game was the tutoriel. The tutoriel might aswell just give you the first level, show you where you can see our army outside of battle and then leave. It COMPLETELY defeats the objective of a tutoriel. Also, by the time you get to the end of the fourth level, all of your army members get either one shot by the mobs at the first wave, or deal NO damage what so ever, let alone the giant just ♥♥♥♥♥♥ you like there's no tomorrow.  Now, like I said it's a free game, so you cant say it's a waste of money, however it was a waste of my time, just clicking the 'go' button about 1000 times, please if you are considering to atleast try this game out you need to be calm at the beginning otherwise you won't get anyway (without buying anything with real money)  ~I hope this review helped you (if you actually read it)

Fun game for a casual type and a great time killer

After spending almost 300 hrs playing this game I believe I've gained a greater understanding of the finer working for this game. If you have no prior knowledge to games that use the fuse and evolve mechanisms you might find yourself at a great disadvantage. I'll simplfy things by simply saying seek and save evey Elite unit you can. In the long run only the Elites are worth Evolving, and do yourself a favore and find out what units max beyond tier VI. Get yourself into a guild ASAP!! It's vital to be able to collect as many units as possible to be of any use in the game. If you simply want to play the story map I'm sure you could be done within a month maybe two. I don't understand the reviews that state they couldn't play for more than a couple hours each day. In the beginning if you do your leveling right you'll have your food totally restored and can continue to level through the map. I never ran into an issue of not having enough food until the higher levels. So yes strategy is a must in this game. But let's not get ahead of ourselves. Luck is a big factor also. Instead of trying to fashion an Army I simply worked with what they gave me. I spend very little time farming for the sake of reborning a unit, to obtain what I want. I will reborn units to make units that I have a lot of simply to raise them up to a higher Tier. The game uses food and you have to give a number of food to run a mission, usually 20. You have flames that limit the number of attacks you can conduct for PVP. The food takes some time to replenish the flames are much faster.  I nearly gave up on this game a month ago. It was starting to feel like a lot of work. So much farming to bring units up. To cut back on farming time I buy more space for my army. In the beginning we was receiving a lot of gems (in game currency, you can purchase these but they are very expensive). Yes like any Pay 2 Win game we have our fare share of Whales. But they all seem to fall into the #1 guild and never seem to bother us. We usually land in #4 spot. Okay so I don't buy gems but I do buy the premium deal for 4.99/ month this gives me 40 gems a day wich I save to buy space for my army. I'm currently at 290 spots and next Friday space is half off I will buy and additional 50 spaces. This allows me to farm more effectively.  One more thing there is something that we have no control over that is the percentage of Elite and Rainbow units we can receive from farming or simply leveling up. And for those who cry about not having enough food to keep leveling really don't understand the mechanics of the game. If these percentages fall to low, as I stated first and for most the only units worth keeping are Elites!! Then you should back off and allow the percentages to replenish.   WolfRuddle is my Guild. I'm Uncanny. Sorry I don't know my code off hand or I would include it. But honestly I don't need the additonal units for simply inviting a friend. But I am very active and constatly update my friendslist to take on those who are just as active and cutoff those who have fallen behind.  I started on day one of the release date for Steam. It takes a tremendous amount of time to be effective in this game. That or a whole lot of money... About $1000 would buy you a very kick ♥♥♥ army, anything less and it might not be worth putting any money into it at all. Unless you want to play all the time then the 4.99/ month is the best deal. You can upgrade the 4.99 to 9.99 and enjoy double the benefits for a month. Do yourself a huge favore and pay the 4.99/ month!! Some of these guys have been playing for a couple years while it was in Beta phase so don't be suprised to see an army that is worth $1,000's. If you was to try and complete with that army from day one it would take so much money to get it.  In reveiw: SAVE EVERY ELITE YOU GET IN THE BEGINNING! LONG RUNNER TIME SAVER BUY LOTS OF SPACE FOR UNITS!! PAY THE 4.99/ MONTH. JOIN WOLFRUDDLE!!

Great, well planned game that you don't need to spend to compete. Just be prepared to spend a lot of time playing. I see some reviews that complain that to be very top you have to spend to win, but the game does a good job of not having you compete again players those spenders.
